projectGridLines.title: Design of DC-DC converters for Electric Vehicles
projectGridLines.description:
Description:As a Power Electronics intern at Ergon, you will be involved in designing the DC-DC

converter section of the patented Integrated Power Converter- a three-in-one power

electronics solution for light electric vehicles that combines a Fast On-board Charger,

Motor Controller and DC-DC converter.

The DC-DC converter supplies power to all the circuitry within our system and also to

auxiliary loads on the vehicle. You will be responsible for determining the power supply

architecture, followed by design and testing of the converter.

Skill sets:

Power Electronics, Electromagnetic Theory, Analog and Digital Electronics, member of

Formula Student/SAE Baja club

Expected learning:

Through the course of this internship, you will obtain hands-on experience with end-end

design of a power converter. This includes topology selection, design calculations,

magnetics design, component selection, schematics capture, PCB layout, board bring-up

and eventually, testing your design on electric vehicles. You will gain exposure to industry

standard software tools and lab instrumentation used for electronics development. In

addition, you will have an opportunity to understand the current landscape of electric

vehicle technology and future prospects in the domain.

Specific courses required for project execution:

? Electromagnetic Theory

? Electronic Devices

? Microprocessors and interfacing

? Control Systems

? Modern Control Systems

? Microelectronic Circuits

? Electronic Instrumentation & Instrumentation Technology

? Analog Electronics

? Power Electronics

? Control System Laboratory

? Electrical and Electronic Circuits Laboratory

? Electromagnetic Compatibility

? Power Systems Laboratory

? Embedded System Design

? Digital Control

? Hardware Software Co-Design

projectGridLines.title: Thermal Management of Electric Vehicle Power Converters
projectGridLines.description:
Description:

As a Mechanical Engineering Intern at Ergon, you will be involved in developing

optimized thermal management strategies for AC-DC, DC-DC and other power

converters.

Skill sets:

Heat and Mass Transfer, CFD simulations, CAD (SolidWorks, CATIA or similar),

Manufacturing Processes

Expected learning:

Through the course of this internship, you will obtain hands-on experience with designing,

testing and manufacturing thermal management systems of automotive components.

This includes designing forced air cooling systems by performing CFD and castability

simulations, validating simulation results with test data and assisting in taking your design

to production. You will gain exposure to industry standard software tools and lab instrumentation. In addition, you will have an opportunity to understand the current

landscape of electric vehicle technology and future prospects in the domain.

projectGridLines.title: Developing Go-to-Market Strategy for Novel Electric Vehicle Components
projectGridLines.description:
Description:

As a Business Development intern at Ergon, you will be involved in shaping the

go-to-market strategy for our patented fast-charging technology for Light EVs. This will

involve identifying the right vehicle manufacturers in target segments, pitching our

charging solution to them, generating opportunities for pilots and liaising between

potential customers and our engineering team.

In addition, you will also be responsible for marketing our solution and creating brand

awareness through our website social media accounts. This will include copywriting,

visual/graphic design, writing blog posts, coordinating with web developers etc.

Skill sets:

Oral and written communication, content creation, graphic design, secondary research,

member of Center for Entrepreneurial Leadership

Expected learning:

Through the course of this internship, you will gain hands-on experience with pitching a

novel hardware solution to vehicle manufacturers and understand what it takes to sell a

functional and safety critical product. You will hone your oral and written communication

skills by interacting with potential customers and creating advertising campaigns.

Moreover, you will be networking with various stakeholders, giving you a great headstart

for a career in the electric vehicle industry.

Specific courses required for project execution:

Mandatory:

? New Venture Creation

? Business Communication

? Mass Media Content and Design

Good-to-have

? Design Thinking for Innovation and Entrepreneurship

? Print & Audio-Visual Advertising

? Introduction to Mass Communication
